title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 128.10 - Inspection and disposition of shipments
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 128.10 - Inspection and disposition of shipments

State Regulations

Any vehicle or other conveyance, any package or other
container, and any item to be moved, which is moving, or which has been moved
intrastate from the quarantine area which may contain a regulated article is
subject to be examined by an inspector. When items are found to be moving or to
have been moved intrastate in violation of these regulations, the inspector may
take such action as he or she deems necessary to eliminate the danger of
dissemination of ECFF. If found to be moved in violation such items must be
rendered free of infestation without cost to the State other than services of
the inspector. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1

128.10

New

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
